 
MAINE STATE LEGISLATURE

LAW AND LEGISLATIVE DIGITAL LIBRARY  
at the Maine State Law and Legislative Reference Library 
http://legislature.m aine.gov/lawlib

(may include minor formatting diffe rences from printed original) 
 
 
Printed on recycled paper130th MAINE LEGISLATURE
SECOND REGULAR SESSION-2022
Legislative Document No. 1936
H.P. 1448 House of Representatives, January 25, 2022
An Act To Codify the Senate and House Legislative Districts, the 
Congressional Districts and the County Commissioner Districts as 
Enacted by the Legislature
(EMERGENCY)
Reported by Representative DUNPHY of Old Town for the Revisor of Statutes pursuant to 
Public Law 2021, chapter 487, section 3; chapter 488, section 3; chapter 489, section 3; and 
chapter 490, section 3.
Received by the Clerk of the House on January 21, 2022.  Referred to the Committee on 
State and Local Government pursuant to Joint Rule 308.2 and ordered printed.
ROBERT B. HUNT
Clerk

Page 1 - 130LR2530(01)1Emergency preamble.  Whereas, acts and resolves of the Legislature do not 
2 become effective until 90 days after adjournment unless enacted as emergencies; and
3Whereas, the Legislature, in Public Law 2021, chapters 487, 488, 489 and 490, 
4 reapportioned Maine's congressional districts, county commissioner districts and districts 
5 of the State Senate and State House of Representatives, respectively, by adopting the plans 
6 submitted by the apportionment commission and incorporating those plans by reference in 
7 the respective chaptered laws; and
8Whereas, legislation is necessary to codify in the Maine Revised Statutes the plans 
9 incorporated by reference so that information is available publicly as soon as possible and 
10 in adequate time to allow for the planning and conduct of the primary and general elections 
11 to be held in 2022; and
12Whereas, in the judgment of the Legislature, these facts create an emergency within 
13 the meaning of the Constitution of Maine and require the following legislation as 
14 immediately necessary for the preservation of the public peace, health and safety; now, 
15 therefore,
16Be it enacted by the People of the State of Maine as follows:
17PART A
18Sec. A-1.  21-A MRSA ยง1203-C is enacted to read:
19ยง1203-C.  State Senate districts
20 For Legislatures beginning with the 131st Legislature, the State Senate consists of 35 
21 Senators, with one Senator elected from each of the following districts.
221.  Senate District 1.  Senate District 1, wholly located in Aroostook County, consists 
23 of the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of Allagash; Ashland; Caribou; 
24 Castle Hill; Caswell; Chapman; Connor Township; Cyr Plantation; Eagle Lake; Fort 
25 Fairfield; Fort Kent; Frenchville; Garfield Plantation; Grand Isle; Hamlin; Limestone; 
26 Madawaska; Mapleton; Masardis; Nashville Plantation; New Canada; New Sweden; 
27 Northwest Aroostook; Perham; Portage Lake; Square Lake; St. Agatha; St. Francis; St. 
28 John Plantation; Stockholm; Van Buren; Wade; Wallagrass; Washburn; Westmanland; 
29 Winterville Plantation; and Woodland.
302.  Senate District 2.  Senate District 2 consists of:
31 A. In Aroostook County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of Amity; 
32 Blaine; Bridgewater; Central Aroostook; Crystal; Dyer Brook; Easton; Glenwood 
33 Plantation; Hammond; Haynesville; Hersey; Hodgdon; Houlton; Island Falls; Linneus; 
34 Littleton; Ludlow; Macwahoc Plantation; Mars Hill; Merrill; Monticello; Moro 
35 Plantation; New Limerick; Oakfield; Orient; Presque Isle; Reed Plantation; Sherman; 
36 Smyrna; South Aroostook; Westfield; and Weston; and
37 B. In Penobscot County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of 
38 Chester; Drew Plantation; East Millinocket; Kingman Township; Mattawamkeag; 
39 Maxfield; Medway; Millinocket; Mount Chase; North Penobscot; Patten; Seboeis 
40 Plantation; Stacyville; and Woodville.
413.  Senate District 3. Senate District 3 consists of:
Page 2 - 130LR2530(01)1 A.   In Kennebec County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of 
2 Benton; Clinton; and Unity Township; 
3 B.   In Penobscot County, the minor civil divisions of Dixmont; Etna; Newport; 
4 Plymouth; and Stetson; and
5 C.   In Somerset County, the minor civil divisions of Canaan; Detroit; Madison; 
6 Norridgewock; Palmyra; Pittsfield; and Skowhegan.
74.  Senate District 4. Senate District 4 consists of:
8 A.   In Penobscot County, the minor civil divisions of Bradford; Charleston; Corinna; 
9 Corinth; Dexter; Exeter; Garland; Glenburn; Hudson; Kenduskeag; and Levant; and
10 B.   Piscataquis County.
115.  Senate District 5. Senate District 5 consists of:
12 A.   In Franklin County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of 
13 Carrabassett Valley; Chesterville; East Central Franklin; Farmington; Industry; 
14 Kingfield; New Sharon; New Vineyard; Strong; Wilton; and Wyman Township;
15 B.   In Kennebec County, the minor civil divisions of Rome and Vienna; and
16 C.   In Somerset County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of Anson; 
17 Athens; Bingham; Brighton Plantation; Cambridge; Caratunk; Central Somerset; 
18 Cornville; Dennistown Plantation; Embden; Harmony; Hartland; Highland Plantation; 
19 Jackman; Mercer; Moose River; Moscow; New Portland; Northeast Somerset; 
20 Northwest Somerset; Pleasant Ridge Plantation; Ripley; Seboomook Lake; Smithfield; 
21 Solon; St. Albans; Starks; The Forks Plantation; and West Forks Plantation.
226.  Senate District 6.  Senate District 6 consists of:
23 A.   In Hancock County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of 
24 Amherst; Aurora; Central Hancock; East Hancock; Eastbrook; Franklin; Gouldsboro; 
25 Great Pond; Hancock; Mariaville; Northwest Hancock; Osborn; Sorrento; Sullivan; 
26 Waltham; and Winter Harbor; and
27 B.   Washington County.
287.  Senate District 7.  Senate District 7 consists of:
29 A.   In Hancock County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of Bar 
30 Harbor; Blue Hill; Brooklin; Brooksville; Castine; Cranberry Isles; Deer Isle; 
31 Ellsworth; Frenchboro; Lamoine; Marshall Island; Mount Desert; Orland; Penobscot; 
32 Sedgwick; Southwest Harbor; Stonington; Surry; Swan's Island; Tremont; Trenton; 
33 and Verona Island; and
34 B.   In Knox County, the minor civil division of Isle au Haut.
358.  Senate District 8.  Senate District 8, wholly located in Penobscot County, consists 
36 of the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of Alton; Argyle Township; 
37 Burlington; Carroll Plantation; East Central Penobscot; Edinburg; Enfield; Greenbush; 
38 Howland; Lagrange; Lakeville; Lee; Lincoln; Lowell; Milford; Old Town; Orono; 
39 Passadumkeag; Penobscot Indian Island; Prentiss Township; Springfield; Twombly Ridge 
40 Township; Veazie; Webster Plantation; Whitney Township; and Winn.

811.  Senate District 11.  Senate District 11 consists of Waldo County.
912.  Senate District 12.  Senate District 12, wholly located in Knox County, consists 
10 of the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of Appleton; Camden; Criehaven; 
11 Cushing; Friendship; Hope; Matinicus Isle Plantation; Muscle Ridge Islands; North Haven; 
12 Owls Head; Rockland; Rockport; South Thomaston; St. George; Thomaston; Union; 
13 Vinalhaven; and Warren. 
1413.  Senate District 13.  Senate District 13 consists of:
15 A.   In Kennebec County, the minor civil division of Windsor; 
16 B.   In Lincoln County, the minor civil divisions and unorganized territories of Alna; 
17 Boothbay; Boothbay Harbor; Bremen; Bristol; Damariscotta; Edgecomb; Hibberts 
18 Gore; Jefferson; Louds Island; Monhegan Plantation; Newcastle; Nobleboro; 
19 Somerville; South Bristol; Southport; Waldoboro; Westport Island; Whitefield; and 
20 Wiscasset; and

2214.  Senate District 14.  Senate District 14, wholly located in Kennebec County, 
23 consists of the minor civil divisions of Chelsea; Farmingdale; Gardiner; Hallowell; 
24 Manchester; Monmouth; Pittston; Randolph; Readfield; Wayne; West Gardiner; and 
25 Winthrop.
2615.  Senate District 15.  Senate District 15, wholly located in Kennebec County, 
27 consists of the minor civil divisions of Augusta; Belgrade; China; Mount Vernon; Sidney; 
28 and Vassalboro.
2916.  Senate District 16.  Senate District 16 consists of:
30 A.   In Kennebec County, the minor civil divisions of Albion; Oakland; Waterville; and 
31 Winslow; and
32 B.   In Somerset County, the minor civil division of Fairfield.
3317.  Senate District 17. Senate District 17 consists of:
34 A.   In Androscoggin County, the minor civil divisions of Greene; Leeds; Lisbon; 
35 Livermore; Livermore Falls; Sabattus; Turner; and Wales; and
36 B.   In Kennebec County, the minor civil divisions of Fayette and Litchfield.

39 B.   In Cumberland County, the minor civil divisions of Bridgton and Harrison; and

4Sec. B-1.  21-A MRSA ยง1204-C is enacted to read:
5ยง1204-C.  State House districts
6 For Legislatures beginning with the 131st Legislature, the following House Districts 
7 are established.

Page 85 - 130LR2530(01)1PART C
2Sec. C-1.  21-A MRSA ยง1205-A is enacted to read:
3ยง1205-A.  Congressional districts
4 The State is divided into 2 districts for the election of Representatives to the United 
5 States Congress as follows.
61.  First District. The First District consists of the counties of Cumberland, Knox, 
7 Lincoln, Sagadahoc and York and the following municipalities and areas within Kennebec 
8 County: Albion, Benton, China, Clinton, Litchfield, Pittston, Unity Township, Vassalboro, 
9 Waterville, West Gardiner, Windsor and Winslow.
102.  Second District. The Second District consists of the counties of Androscoggin, 
11 Aroostook, Franklin, Hancock, Oxford, Penobscot, Piscataquis, Somerset, Waldo and 
12 Washington and the following municipalities and areas within Kennebec County: Augusta, 
13 Belgrade, Chelsea, Farmingdale, Fayette, Gardiner, Hallowell, Manchester, Monmouth, 
14 Mount Vernon, Oakland, Randolph, Readfield, Rome, Sidney, Vienna, Wayne and 
15 Winthrop.
16PART D
17Sec. D-1.  30-A MRSA ยง67 is enacted to read:
18ยง67.  County commissioner districts
191.  Creation of Androscoggin County Commissioner Districts. Androscoggin 
20 County is divided into the following 7 districts.

22 civil division of Lewiston: Census Tract 201; Block 2010, Block 2011, Block 2012,

9 commissioner from this district expires in 2022 and every 4 years thereafter.

11 unorganized territories of Ashland, Caribou, Castle Hill, Central Aroostook, Chapman,

42 from this district expires in 2022 and every 4 years thereafter.1

Page 93 - 130LR2530(01)1 C.  Commissioner District Number 3 consists of the minor civil divisions of Buxton, 
2 Hollis, Old Orchard Beach and Saco. The term of office of the commissioner from this 
3 district expires in 2022 and every 4 years thereafter.
4 D.  Commissioner District Number 4 consists of the minor civil divisions of Alfred, 
5 Dayton, Limerick, Lyman, Sanford and Waterboro. The term of office of the 
6 commissioner from this district expires in 2024 and every 4 years thereafter.
7 E.  Commissioner District Number 5 consists of the minor civil divisions of Eliot, 
8 Kittery, Ogunquit, Wells and York. The term of office of the commissioner from this 
9 district expires in 2024 and every 4 years thereafter.
10Emergency clause.  In view of the emergency cited in the preamble, this legislation 
11 takes effect when approved.
12SUMMARY
13 The Legislature, in Public Law 2021, chapters 487, 488, 489 and 490, reapportioned 
14 Maine's congressional districts, county commissioner districts and districts of the State 
15 Senate and State House of Representatives, respectively.  Each of the public laws adopted 
16 the unanimous plans for reapportionment submitted by the apportionment commission, 
17 incorporated those plans by reference in the respective chaptered laws and required the 
18 Revisor of Statutes to submit a bill to the Second Regular Session of the 130th Legislature 
19 codifying in the Maine Revised Statutes the reapportionment as enacted by the Legislature.
20 This bill, which is submitted pursuant to that requirement, codifies the apportionment 
21 of election districts in this State as follows.
22 1. Part A codifies the districts for the election of State Senators according to Public 
23 Law 2021, chapter 489, Appendix A.
24 2. Part B codifies the districts for the election of State Representatives according to 
25 Public Law 2021, chapter 490, Appendix A.
26 3. Part C codifies the districts for the election of Representatives to the United States 
27 Congress according to Public Law 2021, chapter 487, Appendix A.
28 4. Part D codifies the districts for the election of county commissioners according to 
29 Public Law 2021, chapter 488, Appendix A.13
